Detailed Description

Internal abstraction of a client OBEX transport connection.

Warning;
This is an internal interface and must not be used outside APOXI OBEX at all.

Its purpose is to provide an abstraction of the underlying transport connection and notify OBEX protocol events to the application layer without further evaluation. This activity is left to derived classes.

Member Function Documentation

void ObexClientDispatcher::AbortSelection (   )  [protected]
 

Abort user interaction (Transport Address Selection procedure).

ObexResult ObexClientDispatcher::Close (   )  [virtual]
 

Closes an open transport connection.

When the procedure was properly initiated, the ObexResult value returned indicates success, otherwise it carries an error code. In the former case, the notification method OnClose() is called on completion of the asynchronous procedure.

Note:
When Close() is called while a call to Open() is still pending, the running open operation will be cancelled and OnOpen() be invoked with the error code ObexResult::OperationAborted. In this case, OnClose() is not invoked.

ObexResult ObexClientDispatcher::CloseAction (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Action method initiating closing of a transport connection.

Derived classes may re-implement this method to perform additional tasks when a transport connection is opened.

Implementations should follow the example below: 

            class MyClientImpl : public ObexClientDispatcher {
                public:
                    // ... other declarations
                protected:
                    virtual ObexResult  CloseAction();
                    // ... other declarations
            };

            ObexResult  MyClientImpl::CloseAction()
            {
                // Call inherited method first
                ObexResult  result = Base::CloseAction();

                // Don't proceed when inherited method failed !
                if ( result.IsOk() ) {
                    // Your new code goes here ...
                }
                return result;
            }

ObexClientDispatcher::ClientPortPtr ObexClientDispatcher::GetActivePortPtr (   )  const [protected]
 

Returns a smartpointer to the active port.

Returns:
Pointer to the active port, empty smartpointer if the server is idle.

ObexAddrPtr ObexClientDispatcher::GetRemoteAddrPtr (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the address of the service the client is connected to.

Returns:
When the client is connected to a remote server, the smartpointer which is returned refers to an instance of a class was derived from ObexClientAddr. When the client is not connected, an empty smartpointer is returned.

void ObexClientDispatcher::Init (  ExecutionContext *  ctx_ptr  )  [virtual]
 

Initializes a default-constructed object.

Parameters:
ctx_ptr Execution context to be used by the dispatcher. You may pass '0' as actual parameter to specify the current execution context. In the latter case, the context must be valid when Init() is called.

BOOLEAN ObexClientDispatcher::IsValidContext (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Tells whether the current context is valid for handling notifications.

This method must be implemented by derived classes whose instances might be shared by multiple execution contexts to tell whether an event may be processed and notified in the current execution context or not. The default implementation returns 'TRUE', which is appropriate for all implementations which are run in a single execution context.

Implements ObexEventHandler.

Reimplemented in ObexClientOppImpl.

virtual BOOLEAN ObexClientDispatcher::OnChannelsMatch (  const ClientPortPtr &  port_ptr,
const ObexMsg &  msg
)  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Indicates reception of an OBEX event.

This notification method is called whenever an ObexMsg is received which is related to the transport channel opened by the related ObexClientDispatcher instance. Derived classes mut implement it to dispatch the various events resulting from communication using an OBEX-based protocol.

Parameters:
port_ptr Port from which the OBEX event was received
msg ObexMsg containing the event type and data

virtual void ObexClientDispatcher::OnClose (  ObexResult  result  )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Indicates completion of a Close() operation.

Implemented in ObexClient, and ObexClientOppImpl.

virtual void ObexClientDispatcher::OnOpen (  ObexResult  result  )  [protected, pure virtual]

Implemented in ObexClient, and ObexClientOppImpl.

ObexResult ObexClientDispatcher::Open (  const String &  obex_addr_url  )  [virtual]
 

Opens a transport connection to a remote server.

When the procedure was properly initiated, the ObexResult value returned indicates success, otherwise it carries an error code. In the former case, the notification method OnOpen() is called on completion of the asynchronous procedure.

Parameters:
obex_addr_url OBEX address in URL format. Please see OBEX URL's for further explanation.

ObexResult ObexClientDispatcher::OpenAction (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Action method initiating opening of a transport connection.

Derived classes may re-implement this method to perform additional tasks when a transport connection is opened. Implementations should follow the example below: 

            class MyClientImpl : public ObexClientDispatcher {
                public:
                    // ... other declarations
                protected:
                    virtual ObexResult  OpenAction();
                    // ... other declarations
            };

            ObexResult  MyClientImpl::OpenAction()
            {
                // Call inherited method first
                ObexResult  result = Base::OpenAction();

                // Don't proceed when inherited method failed !
                if ( result.IsOk() ) {
                    // Your new code goes here ...
                }
                return result;
            }
